isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14618 AND RTLO-16618 SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - INTEGRAL OIL PUMP

figure.caption: Figure 122. Integral Oil Pump Exploded View

step1.para: Straighten lock tang on the suction tube (inset, Figure 123) and remove suction tube from the oil pump. If necessary, remove O-ring from the suction tube.

figure.caption: Figure 123. Remove Suction Tube From Oil Pump

step1.para: Remove three Allen head screws and washers that retain the integral oil pump to the front of the case ( Figure 124).

figure.caption: Figure 124. Remove Screws and Washers Retaining Integral Oil Pump to Front of Case

step1.para: Remove the integral oil pump from the case ( Figure 125).

figure.caption: Figure 125. Remove Integral Oil Pump From Case

step1.para: Remove the integral oil pump retainer plate from the case ( Figure 126).

figure.caption: Figure 126. Remove Integral Oil Pump Retainer Plate

step1.para: Remove the outer oil pump element from the pump ( Figure 127).

figure.caption: Figure 127. Remove Outer Oil Pump Element From Pump

step1.para: Remove the drive gear retaining snap ring from the drive shaft ( Figure 128).

figure.caption: Figure 128. Remove Drive Gear Retaining Snap Ring From Drive Shaft

step1.para: Remove the drive gear from the pump drive shaft ( Figure 129).

figure.caption: Figure 129. Remove Drive Gear From Pump Drive Shaft

step1.para: Remove the key from the drive shaft keyway ( Figure 130).

figure.caption: Figure 130. Remove Key From Drive Shaft Keyway

step1.para: Remove the element retaining snap ring from the drive shaft ( Figure 131).

figure.caption: Figure 131. Remove Element Retaining Snap Ring From Drive Shaft

step1.para: Remove the internal oil pump element from the drive shaft ( Figure 132).

figure.caption: Figure 132. Remove Internal Oil Pump Element

step1.para: Remove the two keys from the drive shaft keyways ( Figure 133).

figure.caption: Figure 133. Remove Keys From Drive Shaft Keyways

step1.para: Remove the drive shaft from the integral oil pump housing ( Figure 134). If necessary, remove the rear drive gear retention snap ring from the drive shaft.

figure.caption: Figure 134. Remove Drive Shaft From Integral Oil Pump Housing

step1.para: Remove the relief valve roll pin from the pump housing ( Figure 135). The relief valve spring can now be removed from the relief valve housing bore (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 135. Remove Relief Valve Roll Pin From Pump Housing

step1.para: Remove the relief valve from the housing bore ( Figure 136).

figure.caption: Figure 136. Remove Relief Valve From Housing Bore

step1.para: If necessary, the front case plug can be removed from the case by driving the plug through the front of the case ( Figure 137). Remove the O-ring from the O.D. of the plug if necessary.
